See also: Gestern

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

Ultimately from Proto-Germanic *gestra-, from Proto-Indo-European *dʰǵʰyes-. Compare English yester(day), Dutch gisteren.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈɡɛstərn/, /ˈɡɛstɐn/
  • IPA(key): /ˈɡɛstn/ (Mecklenburg-Vorpommern)
  • audio (Germany)
    		(file)
  • audio (Austria)
    		(file)

Adverb[edit]

gestern

  1. yesterday

Derived terms[edit]

  • gestrig
  • von gestern

Further reading[edit]

  • gestern in Duden online
